metadata.dc:title: No disponible
metadata.dc:creator: Down Syndrome Education International
metadata.dc:description: This is the third and last part of the series edited by Down Syndrome Education International showing the state of the art in the current educative research on Down syndrome early stages. They describe modern advances in the field of educational research in Down syndrome, and face to the questions that remain unresolved. This part (articles 14-21) includes the following issues: attention, intervention, sleep, vision, hearing, motor development, executive function, play and socialization (AU)
metadata.dc:title: Moderna investigación educativa en el síndrome de Down (III Parte)
